text: Gianmaria Sarri (born 6 July 1973) is an Italian male wheelchair fencer who won medals at the Paralympic Games. ==Biography== Sarri in addition to his four Olympian participations (he boasts a bronze medal), he also boasts 7 medals at the world championships (three gold) and six at the European championships. ==Achievements== {| class="wikitable" width=45% style="font- size:90%; text-align:center;" |- !Year !!Competition !!Venue !!Rank!!Event |- |2004 |align=left|Paralympic Games |align=left| Athens | |Foil B |- |rowspan=2|2008 |rowspan=2 align=left|Paralympic Games |rowspan=2 align=left| Beijing | |Sabre B |- | |Foil B |- |2012 |align=left|Paralympic Games |align=left| London |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |Sabre B |- |rowspan=2|2016 |rowspan=2 align=left|Paralympic Games |rowspan=2 align=left| Rio de Janeiro | |Sabre B |- | |Foil B |} ==References== ==External links== * * Alessio Sarri at Italian National Olympic Committee * Alessio Sarri at Fiamme Oro Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:Paralympic wheelchair fencers of Italy Category:Paralympic bronze medalists for Italy Category:Paralympic athletes of Fiamme Oro Category:Paralympic medalists in wheelchair fencing Category:Medalists at the 2012 Summer Paralympics Category:Wheelchair fencers at the 2012 Summer Paralympics
title: Alessio Sarri
